item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:02 HKT 26/07/2023
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 32 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 73 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 5
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

Super Typhoon Doksuri has entered within 800 kilometres of Hong Kong. The Observatory will issue the Standby Signal, No. 1 tonight. According to the current forecast, Doksuri will move across the northeastern part of the South China Sea, maintain as a severe typhoon to super typhoon and gradually move towards the coastal areas of eastern Guangdong and southern Fujian tomorrow and on Friday (27 and 28 July). The Observatory will consider the distance between Doksuri and the Pearl River Estuary and assess the latest tropical cyclone warning signal. Under the influence of the outer subsiding air of Doksuri, very hot weather will persist in southern China today and tomorrow, with showers and squally thunderstorms possibly triggered by high temperatures. There will be swells. Members of the public should be on the alert on the latest weather forecast.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The weather is extremely hot and there is prolonged heat! Please pay attention to health conditions. Drink more water and take all necessary protective measures against the heat. Avoid vigorous outdoor physical activities. If feeling unwell, seek medical advice as soon as possible.
